item.title: 阿布扎比三年来首次发行欧洲债券融资 50 亿美元
item.description: 阿布扎比出售了自 2021 年以来的首批欧元债券，在今年新兴市场最大的一笔交易中筹集了 50 亿美元。【原文：Abu Dhabi sold its first eurobonds since 2021, raising $5 billion in one of the biggest deals from emerging markets this year.】

item.title: 普拉博沃的助手称印尼不需要再次加息
item.description: 当选总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）的一位经济顾问表示，印尼央行不需要进一步提高利率来保护印尼盾。【原文：Bank Indonesia doesn’t need to further increase interest rates to shield the rupiah, according to an economic advisor of President-elect Prabowo Subianto who sought a monetary policy that’s supportive of growth.】

item.title: 埃尼集团利用强劲现金流将股票回购规模提高至 16 亿欧元
item.description: 由于现金流更加充裕，埃尼公司（Eni SpA）将今年的股票回购计划提高到 16 亿欧元（17 亿美元），同时公布的第一季度利润符合预期。【原文：Eni SpA increased its planned share buyback this year to €1.6 billion ($1.7 billion) due to stronger cash flow, while reporting profit in the first quarter that met estimates.】

item.title: 法国债务持续攀升，信用评级面临考验
item.description: 即将进行的三项评级评估将考验法国的债券市场，使人们关注法国日益恶化的债务状况。【原文：A trio of upcoming rating assessments is set to test France’s bond markets by turning the spotlight on the country’s worsening debt picture.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：期货指向第六天上涨
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所。【原文：The London Stock Exchange.】

item.title: 全球最大能源交易商重返金属市场
item.description: 世界上一些最大的能源贸易公司在经历了众所周知的市场困境多年后，正在重返金属市场。【原文：Some of the world’s biggest energy trading companies are returning to metals, years after getting burnt in the notoriously difficult markets.】

item.title: 碧桂园延长债券期限以避免首次地方违约
item.description: 中国开发商碧桂园控股有限公司（Country Garden Holdings Co.【原文：Chinese developer Country Garden Holdings Co., one of the biggest symbols of the nation’s broader property debt crisis, won approval to push back payments on three yuan bonds, people familiar with the matter said, staving off its first local default for now.】

item.title: 中国铜标尺归零向金属多头发出严正警告
item.description: 衡量中国铜需求的一个关键指标刚刚降至零，这再次表明全球价格与这个最大市场的买家准备支付的价格不平衡。【原文：A key measure of Chinese copper demand just sank to zero, another sign that global prices are not balanced with what buyers in the biggest market are prepared to pay.】

item.title: 欧洲强劲银行股领涨市场面临考验
item.description: 过去三年来，欧洲银行股的涨势一直超过美国同业和纳斯达克指数，未来几天，当该地区大多数主要贷款机构公布业绩时，欧洲银行股将面临关键考验。【原文：A rally that has seen European bank stocks outpace both US peers and the Nasdaq over the last three years faces a key test in coming days when most of the region’s major lenders report results.】

item.title: 汉德森银行收益不佳，成本增长引更多关注
item.description: 瑞典商业银行（Svenska Handelsbanken AB）公布的第一季度盈利不及分析师预期，并表示在成本增长快于收入增长之后，将加倍努力削减开支。【原文：Svenska Handelsbanken AB reported first-quarter earnings that missed analyst estimates and signaled it will double down on slashing expenses after costs rose faster than income.】

item.title: 米莱团队认为阿根廷通胀放缓速度快于经济学家调查
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）的经济团队认为，今年月度通胀放缓的速度将远超分析师的预期，这是在他努力使国家摆脱危机的过程中对其顾问预测的罕见洞察。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei’s economic team sees monthly inflation slowing much faster this year than analysts anticipate, a rare insight into his advisers’ projections as he tries to pull the country out of crisis.】

item.title: 前简氏街交易员对窃取商业机密的指控提出质疑
item.description: 一位转投千禧管理公司（Millennium Management）的前简街集团交易员嘲笑他的前雇主，称他在印度期权市场的新工作中利用该公司的秘密策略大赚了一笔。【原文：A former Jane Street Group trader who moved to Millennium Management ridiculed his former employer’s claims that he used its secret strategy to make a killing at his new job in India’s options market.】

item.title: 全球基金连续抛售印尼股票，创一年来最长纪录
item.description: 外国投资者已经连续 15 天抛售印尼股票，这是自 2023 年 1 月以来持续时间最长的一次，原因是预期利率将长期走高，美元将走强。【原文：Foreign investors have sold Indonesian stocks for 15 straight days, the longest stretch since January 2023, on expectations of a prolonged period of higher interest rates and a stronger US dollar.】

item.title: 港交所利润下降 13% 显示新任首席执行官陈家强面临挑战
item.description: 香港证券交易所第一季度的利润下滑了 13%，这凸显了新任首席执行官陈怿所面临的艰巨任务，因为她要在交易和股票发行的奄奄一息的局面中找到出路。【原文：Hong Kong stock exchange’s profit slid 13% in the first quarter, underscoring the uphill battle faced by new Chief Executive Officer Bonnie Chan as she navigates a moribund landscape for trading and stock offerings.】

item.title: Continuum Green 创始人希望通过 2 亿美元贷款实现投资者退出
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度可再生能源公司Continuum Green Energy Ltd.的创始人已聘请德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）筹集2亿美元贷款，用于向其大股东购买股权。【原文：The founders of India’s renewable energy firm Continuum Green Energy Ltd. have hired Deutsche Bank AG to raise a $200 million loan to fund a stake purchase from its majority shareholder, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国交易员在境外抢购国企股，热炒红利游戏
item.description: 中国投资者在香港股市中的影响力与日俱增，他们在最近的购买狂潮中一直在抢购国有企业。【原文：Chinese investors, an increasingly influential force in Hong Kong’s stock market, have been scooping up state-owned enterprises in their recent buying spree.】

item.title: 印度主要股票风险指数跌至历史最低点，投票开始之际显示出平静气氛
item.description: 由于投资者在等待长达六周的全国大选结果，印度衡量股票风险预期的关键指标周二跌至历史新低。【原文：India’s key measure of equity risk expectations slid to a record low Tuesday, as investors awaited the outcome of the six-week long national election.】

item.title: 中国人民银行加强对长期国债反弹的宣传
item.description: 中国人民银行加强了对长期国债涨势的口头回击，警告市场将出现逆转，并暗示将纠正市场价格与经济前景之间的不匹配。【原文：The People’s Bank of China ramped up its verbal pushback against the rally in long-term government bonds, warning of a reversal and hinting that a mismatch between market prices and the economic outlook will be corrected.】

item.title: Fortescue 称铁矿石出口受矿山中断影响，铁矿石价格上涨
item.description: 铁矿石打破了连续三天的跌势，因为第四大钢铁原料生产商 Fortescue Ltd. 称，在西澳大利亚矿山发生事故后，全年发货量可能会低于指导值。【原文：Iron ore snapped three days of losses as Fortescue Ltd., the fourth-biggest producer of the steel ingredient, said full-year shipments are likely to be at the lower end of guidance after disruptions at Western Australian mines.】

item.title: 销售增长放缓，全球基金抛售联合利华印度股票
item.description: 由于印度斯坦联合利华有限公司（Hindustan Unilever Ltd.）正努力应对疲软的消费需求和日益激烈的竞争，全球投资者已将该公司的持股降至四年来的最低点。【原文：Global investors have cut holdings of Hindustan Unilever Ltd. to a four-year low as the company grapples with weak consumer demand and rising competition.】

item.title: 参议院向拜登提交制裁伊朗石油的一揽子援助计划
item.description: 参议院投票通过了一项对外援助方案，其中包括对伊朗石油部门的制裁，该方案已送交乔-拜登总统，拜登总统表示将签署该法案使之成为法律。【原文：The Senate voted to send a foreign aid package that includes sanctions on Iran’s oil sector to President Joe Biden, who has said he will sign the legislation into law.】

item.title: 猪群萎缩，中国受困猪农寻求转机
item.description: 中国养殖户饲养的种猪数量是 2020 年以来最少的，这为该行业在经历多年亏损后迎来持续盈利带来了希望。【原文：Chinese farmers are keeping the fewest pigs for breeding since 2020, offering hopes that the industry is on the cusp of sustained profitability after years of losses.】

item.title: 中国信贷收益率在债券牛市中跌至历史新低
item.description: 随着投资者在流动性充裕的金融体系中大量购买企业债券以提高回报率，中国的地方信贷收益率已降至历史最低水平。【原文：China’s local credit yields have fallen to the lowest level ever as investors load up on corporate bonds to boost returns in a financial system awash in liquidity.】

item.title: 美国银行顶级印度交易员称掉期市场过于鹰派
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America Corp）称，印度利率交易商已将降息预期推得太远，这给掉期市场带来了机会。【原文：Indian rates traders have pushed back expectations for an interest-rate cut way too far and that creates an opportunity in the swaps market, according to Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 伦敦投资者披露尼康股份，推动股价上涨 11
item.description: 总部设在伦敦、倡导日本企业变革的 Silchester International Investors 公司披露，该公司已入股尼康公司，推动该公司股价创下近三年来最大涨幅。【原文：Silchester International Investors, a London-based firm that has advocated for corporate change in Japan, disclosed it has taken a stake in Nikon Corp., pushing the shares up by the most in almost three years.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势缓和推动黄金连跌两日后保持稳定
item.description: 本周晚些时候将公布的美国数据可能会对美联储的利率路径产生更多影响，在此之前，黄金持稳。【原文：Gold was steady ahead of US data due later this week that may shed more light on the Federal Reserve’s rate path.】

item.title: 阿帕卢萨就 170 亿美元 AT1 债券损失起诉瑞士信贷
item.description: 对冲基金阿帕卢萨（Appaloosa LP）成为最新一家就去年 170 亿美元高风险债券清盘案提起诉讼的公司，该清盘案是拯救瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse Group AG）免于全面崩溃的交易的一部分。【原文：Hedge fund Appaloosa LP became the latest to sue over the $17 billion wipeout of high-risk bonds last year that was part of the deal to save Credit Suisse Group AG from a full-scale collapse.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好科技股正在崛起。特斯拉希望抓紧时间生产更便宜的车型。日本正在密切关注日元走势。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. Tech stocks are roaring back. Tesla wants to hurry up and build cheaper models. And Japan is keeping very close tabs on the yen. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】
